item.title: Error in options[[sprintf("fig.%s", i)]] * options$dpi: ! non-numeric argument to binary operator
item.description: Rubber duck debugging. Photo by Timothy Dykes. If Google leads you here, you probably assigned a character value to a knitr chunk option such as fig.width or fig.height that only accepts numeric values, and your are trying to render that R Markdown or Quarto document. For example, it is easy to make this mistake: ```{r, fig.width="100%"} plot(1:10) ``` where you probably meant: ```{r, fig.width=6, out.width="100%"} plot(1:10) ``` That’s all! I hope this helps.
